metadata.name: Verify that system commands are protected from unauthorized access
metadata.description:
System commands are stored in the following directories by default: 
/bin
/sbin
/usr/bin
/usr/sbin
/usr/local/bin
/usr/local/sbin
All files in these directories should not be group-writable or world-writable. If any file FILE in these directories is found to be group-writable or world-writable, correct its permission with the following command: 
$ sudo chmod 755 FILE
metadata.rationale:
System binaries are executed by privileged users, as well as system services,
and restrictive permissions are necessary to ensure execution of these programs
cannot be co-opted.
